docs.title: Hongfu Sun
docs.text:
Senior Lecturer (Medical Imaging & AI) · University of Newcastle Honorary Senior Research Fellow · University of Queensland

✉️ Email 📄 CV (PDF) 🎓 Google Scholar 💻 GitHub 🟢 ORCID 🔗 LinkedIn

docs.title: About
docs.text:
I work at the intersection of MRI physics and machine learning. My group develops new techniques for Quantitative Susceptibility Mapping (QSM), R2* mapping, and AI-guided reconstruction—aimed at faster, more robust, and clinically useful MRI.

Research themes: QSM methods & validation · MRI reconstruction · Generative models (diffusion) · Deep learning for quantitative MRI.

docs.title: Featured
docs.text: Publications Peer-reviewed journal articles and selected conference papers. 📚 Journal Articles 🧪 Conferences Software Open-source tools for QSM & MRI reconstruction (RESHARP, POEM, iQSM, MoDIP, QSMDiff, xQSM). 🧰 QSM Toolkits 💻 GitHub Teaching Courses & materials in Medical Imaging, Signal Processing, and Programming. 🧑‍🏫 Teaching Students Current students and alumni; project opportunities. 👩‍🔬 Students Awards Selected recognitions (DECRA, UQ awards, ISMRM distinctions). 🏅 Awards

docs.title: News & Talks
docs.text: Below is a running log of talks, papers, and lab updates. (Newest first. Use the page ToC to jump by year.)

• May — 3 papers at ISMRM 2025 (Honolulu), incl. diffusion-model MRI reconstruction and rapid QSM for ICH.
  • Mar — Journal article accepted: DIP-UP: Deep Image Prior for Unwrapping Phase (Information, 2025).
  • Jan — Paper accepted in Medical Physics: QSM via deep neural networks with iterative reverse concatenations.

• Nov — ANZ ISMRM Chapter: talks on controllable diffusion models and MRF reconstruction.
  • May — ISMRM (Singapore): presentations on BFR refinement, MRF-Mixer, and QSM latent feature editing.
  • Jan — Editorial duties & reviews for MRI journals.

• Dec — MoDIP in NeuroImage; Plug-and-Play Latent Feature Editing in Medical Image Analysis.
  • Jun — ISMRM (Toronto): diffusion models for super-resolution and guided MRI reconstruction.

docs.title: QSM Toolkits (💻 GitHub)
docs.text: RESHARP         📄 Paper 💻 GitHub MATLAB Background field removal for QSM Description: RESHARP (Regularization Enabled SHARP) is a background field removal method widely adopted in Quantitative Susceptibility Mapping (QSM). POEM         📄 Paper 💻 GitHub MATLAB Multi-echo arrayed coil combination for phase Description: POEM (Phase-Offsets Estimation Method) enables accurate coil combination for multi-echo acquisitions, improving SNR and phase consistency.

docs.title: Deep Learning Methods (💻 GitHub)
docs.text: iQSM         📄 Paper 💻 GitHub Python Deep Learning Single-step deep learning QSM from raw phase Description: iQSM is a deep learning method that directly reconstructs susceptibility maps from raw phase, bypassing multi-step processing. iQSM+         📄 Paper 💻 GitHub Python Deep Learning Extended iQSM method for single-step QSM Description: iQSM+ builds on iQSM with improved network design and robustness, enabling accurate susceptibility maps even with challenging acquisitions. MoDIP         📄 Paper 💻 GitHub Python Deep Learning Model-based Deep Image Prior for QSM Description: MoDIP is an unsupervised dipole inversion method leveraging deep image prior principles for quantitative susceptibility mapping without training data. AFTER-QSM         📄 Paper 💻 GitHub Python Deep Learning AFTER-QSM for acquisition of any fov orientations (beyond pure axial)  Description: AFTER-QSM uses affine transformation to handle scans of angled FOV, improving robustness and generalizability. QSMDiff         📄 Paper 💻 GitHub Python Deep Learning Diffusion-model-based QSM for EPI scans Description: QSMDiff employs diffusion probabilistic models to reconstruct QSM from undersampled or distorted EPI scans, improving robustness and generalizability. xQSM         📄 Paper 💻 GitHub Python Deep Learning Octave-convolutional neural network for dipole inversion Description: xQSM uses octave convolutions and noise-regularization to robustly solve the dipole inversion problem in QSM. DCRNet         📄 Paper 💻 GitHub Python Deep Learning ODCRNet: Accelerating Quantitative Susceptibility Mapping using Compressed Sensing and Deep Neural Network Description: A deep complex residual network (DCRNet) to recover both MR magnitude and quantitative phase images from the CS undersample k-space data, enabling the acceleration of QSM acquisitions. More Software Coming Soon... DIP-UP, DeepRelaxo, MRF-Mixer and others Additional methods and tools will be added here with detailed descriptions, references, and code repositories.
